title: Notice to attorney general, when
context: §660-26 Notice to attorney general, when. If the person is imprisoned on any criminal accusation, reasonable notice shall be given to the attorney general, or the attorney general&rsquo;s deputy, lawfully appointed, to appear and object if the attorney general or the attorney general&rsquo;s deputy thinks fit. [L 1870, c 32, §19; RL 1925, §2749; RL 1935, §4334; RL 1945, §10375; RL 1955, §239-26; HRS §660-26; gen ch 1985]
